commit message: Init project
Display the signal strength and update it on a set interval
Remove unused imports
Target Android 5.0
Raise minimum supported SDK and target lollipop
Needs permission to change multicast state
Implement onPause, onResume, and onDestroy
Add functionality to get a multicast lock and for operations to be performed on the lock
We are not going to use multicast for discovery
Capitalize MAC address
No title bar on the main activity
Added styling XML files to apply to the host discovery button
Added value for the host discovery button
Added a button at the bottom to start host discovery. Added a listview between the device info at the top and the button at the bottom which will hold hosts and open port information
Formatting
Transitioned project to Android Studio
Formatting and gave the discover hosts button an ID
Formatting and imports cleanup
The button should be icsblue when clicked on and the text white
Finished up the Discovery class. Now looks at and parses the ARP table after making sure the table is filled by making requests to hosts

Implemented the onSaveInstanceState method to save the list of hosts when the phone is rotated and such. Created the listener for when the host discovery button is clicked to start the discovery process. Cleaned up imports. Restore the state of the host list in the onCreate method
Updated build tools
Increased the timeout for connecting to hosts
Remove unused permission

To compensate for hosts that might be underpowered and take a bit longer to respond to an ARP request lets increase the timeout for that process to happen but split up the work a lot more to keep it fast (its actually a little faster than before). Use an executor with a thread pool to split up the work of contacting hosts
Formatting
Remove unused parameter to getExternalIpAddress()
Formatting
Optimization of finding elements in the UI. Removed some unnecessary calls that ended up being performed repeatedly due to where they were positioned
Removed import summary from repo
Formatting
Increase the timeout for connecting to hosts
Split out the colors into their own file and add another string to strings.xml
Display the users SSID
Display the users BSSID
Dont try to scan for hosts if the user isnt connected to the network
Adjust where the LinearLayout that contains the host list is placed. Add another blue separator between the info above and the host list below
More explicit context
Slight formatting
Create a new activity that will handle showing data about the host clicked on from the previous screen. Port scans will also be performed here
Create a spot to show the host IP in the new activity. Pass the host IP that was selected from the main activity to the host activity and show it as a header at the top
Restore the host that was passed to the new activity upon creation (handles screen rotation and other various events that will destroy the activity)

Create a new Host class that will be used for determining various information about a network host. Probably add functionality to scan ports in this class later on. Make the host activity create a new instance of the Host class and get the host name. Implement functionality to async get the host name of the host passed from the main activity
A bit of refactoring
Instantiate the host object later on once we have the host IP (oops)
Get the host name of the clicked on host from the main activity and now display it to the user in the new activity
Get the remote hosts MAC address by scanning the users ARP table. Once found, display it. Some refactoring of strings and var names

Set up a list view to hold the list of open ports when scanning is in progress. Create a button at the bottom to allow the user to scan the ports for that host. Some refactoring/renaming for better context
Small refactor and get a reference to the scan ports button
Finished building out the port scanning functionality. This currenly only scans well known ports, we need to add another button to scan for a custom range and implement that functionality
Layout the buttons for scanning well known ports and for scanning a custom port range next to each other under the list of ports above

Added some blue separators between the items on the host activity. Changed the size of the header text views on each activity. Added some margin between the different port scanning buttons. Changed some strings
Fix tag name
Show a progress dialog when scanning well known ports instead of just showing a toast notification
Show a progress dialog with real time progress when scanning for hosts instead of just showing a toast notification
Remove toasts that were still being shown after implementing progress
Change progress dialog text to be more headerish (headerish...like a heading...yes....)
Increased the timeouts for scanning hosts and ports
Remove toast when well known ports have finished scanning
Update the progress dialog text when an open port is found
Use a local var for the ip obtained from the ARP table
Make the progress dialogs not cancelable
Show the name of the app at the top. Logo to follow at some point...

Now show the hostname under the IP for each entry in the list of hosts that have been scanned. Now that we need to get the hostname as part of the host scan we can just pass this over to the next activity instead of having to get the host name there once it starts. Removed some now unnecessary code due to all of the changes. Changed how the entries in the host list are sorted due to the new structure with maps and and lists. Changed how data is saved and restored when the activity is destroyed and recreated
Reduce padding between Device Info header and the data
Create the AsyncResponse interface. This will be the start of some code/structure cleanup necessary from all of the changes and different paths this project has taken

Break out the scanning hosts functionality into its own classes (async and runnable). Start to use the new delegate pattern for a way to return data up the chain to the main activity. This means that we no longer have to handle so much of the UI/android stuff in these classes. They will only serve their own purpose and have greater separation of concerns. This will allow future modifications for additional functionality to be easier and reused
Lowercase package names
Extended the interface by overloading the processFinish method
Actually instead of overloading lets just make the type Object so that there will just be one method to implement but everything can use it with casting

Finished breaking out the functionality for scanning hosts using async, runnable, and delegates. UI now basically handles callbacks for certain operations and all UI related stuff like setting up the progress dialog or updating the list view/progress dialog is done ON the UI/activity. No more passing activities around to other classes and manipulating data from there

Renamed AsyncResponse to MainAsyncResponse as we will be using other interfaces for other activities so that an activity will not have to implement methods that it might not use but that other activities rely on

Create HostAsyncResponse interface and make the HostActivity implement it. This will be used for handling return values from async tasks like scanning ports. We are now showing the MAC address under each host that is found during the scan. Because of this we can just pass it along to the next activity and remove the code from the Host class to find the MAC address

Finished breaking out the functionality for scanning well known ports into separate async and callable classes. Used the delegate pattern to get better separation of concerns and to decouple the code more
Create a response package
Broke out functionality to get the host name of a device to keep with the new structure of using delegates
Temporary rename to change casing of packages
Temporary rename for changing casing of packages
Rename to lowercase packages
If the device is rotated (or paused for any reason) while a host scan is in progress handle exceptions that occur when the UI thread is still trying to update the progress dialog
Now under GPL 3
Broke out the functionality for getting the external IP address to further structure and improve the codebase
A bit of restructuring for where activities live

Use proguard file with optimizations enableed
Import optimizations
Create a layout for the dialog that will be popped up when the port range button is clicked. Put a stop and start number picker inside the dialog and set their max values before they are displayed
Set min values for the port range pickers
Add margin between the two port range pickers
Give the scan port range dialog a title
Make textviews above each port range picker and center them. Change how each port range picker is laid out and group them together with their own internal layouts
Speed up the host discovery
Sped up the well known port scanning process but also increased the accuracy. Now using 64 threads instead of 8. Change the logic for how the work is split up and parallelized
Use more threads when performing host discovery. Change the logic for how the work is split up and parallelized. Increase the timeout connecting to a host for greater accuracy
A bit of refactoring to make the scan well known ports task to be more generic so that it can handle any range of ports thrown at it
Logic fix
Increase the timeout to connect to a port on the remote host but greatly increase the thread pool size
Reuse the socket address
Increase the timeout for connecting to a port on a remote host

Refactor of ScanPortsCallable to make this a runnable instead. We can update the progress of the scan through the use of the delegate and do everything we need to on the activity using the data thats passed back
Add a button below the port range pickers to start the range scan
Give the range scan button an id
Made the scan port range functionality work. Tweaked the logic in the scan ports callable to handle some edge cases
Added the apps icon in all of the different sizes that might be used
Create two project flavors. One for the free version and one for the donate version
Get rid of the default config
We arent going to use a custom proguard rule file
Update support lib to be used

Dont set the min and target sdk in the gradle file. This is already done in the manifest
